description.para: Gets the copy of EzStr object to which EzStr object enumerator is currently pointing.

param_note.para: Gets the copy of EzStr object.

tr.td: Function succeeds in getting the current object.
Invalid argument(s). psa is null or the size of psa is less than the size actually needed.
Invalid operation. EzStr enumerator points before the first object of EzStr object set; or EzStr object set is modified; or call Current method before calling MoveNext and it returns S_FALSE.

remarks.para: EzStr object enumerator points before the first object of EzStr object set after creating an EzStr object enumerator or calling Reset. Calling Current at this point in time is invalid and will return false. So you should call MoveNext to make EzStr object forward to the corresponding object and then call Current to get any copy of EzStr object.
Before calling MoveNext or Reset again, if the object pointed to EzStr object enumerator is not changed, one can get the same copy of EzStr object by calling Current many times.

If some modifications are made to EzSstr object set (adding or deleting EzStr object), it is a must to call Reset to reset EzStr object enumerator, otherwise it will return false while calling Current and MoveNext.
If MoveNext returns S_FALSE and then calling Current will return E_INVALID_OPERATION.

system.system_name: Windows 2000 or later; Elastos 2.0 or later.
